definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)
to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
understanding and enjoying (a work of art)
can be enjoyed by scholars and lay-people alike (idiom)
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward

sentences.english: The flowers give straight must admire, Mo to be whispering a beginning.
sentences.chinese: 有花堪賞直須賞，莫待花落憶初開。

sentences.english: A father and his children were down on the dock, admiring the sunset together.
sentences.chinese: 一個父親與他的兩個孩子站在河埠頭上一起賞落日。

sentences.english: If visitors have right solutions to the riddles, they will get a little gift.
sentences.chinese: 如果賞花燈的人猜中謎底，就會得到小禮物。

sentences.english: Solving riddles on lanterns has been a popular tradition since the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 正月十五賞花燈是元宵節必有的另一項習俗。

sentences.english: And God gave to Daniel grace and mercy in the sight of the prince of the eunuchs.
sentences.chinese: 天主賞達尼爾在宦官長眼中獲得寵遇和同情。

sentences.english: Reward human music, fluttering autumn leaf Sasa rain.
sentences.chinese: 賞人間曲，飄飄秋葉灑灑雨。

sentences.english: Sighing enjoy myself alone, tide girls laughing laugh.
sentences.chinese: 方嘆獨自賞，潮女笑開懷。

sentences.english: Watching lanterns has been enjoyed by Chinese people since ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 賞花燈從古代中國以來就一直受到中國人的喜愛。

sentences.english: Sometimes couples would go on dates strolling down the streets lit with lantern lights.
sentences.chinese: 未婚男女也常藉着賞花燈與情人相會。

sentences.english: I hope my visit does not cause you too much trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我希看此次來不雅觀賞沒有給你們增加太多的費事。

sentences.english: My name is Wesley Cheng, and the flight number is UA 003 for Toronto.
sentences.chinese: 我的名字是傑瑞煩“嗷怕朧欠賞逕薊牧蝦嬌03班機。

sentences.english: When the perfect-circle moon comes out, people will go to the yard while eating moon cakes.
sentences.chinese: 圓月當空之時，人們步入庭院，喫月餅，賞月亮。

sentences.english: At the lake, enjoy nine days distant phoenix.
sentences.chinese: 看一湖秋月，賞遠處鳳凰九天。

definition: to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc
